titleStmt.title: W. E. Hamilton et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10223

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his excellency Gov. B. Magoffin

Your Petitioner Jeremiah Proctor Most humbly Solicits your excellency to remit the fine imposed on him of $22.91 1/2 cents by a Justice of the peace of Carter County Kentucky, it being the same fine which he has heretofore Petitioned Your excellency to remit and your excellency respited the Same for Twelve months which time will now soon expire

The undersiged Joined in the prayer with your Humble Petition and now asks that said fine be remitted they Most respectfully represent that Said Proctor is a young man and like a Great Many is poor and he Seldom gets into difficulties and has not been in one Since he was tried & fined as Stated in his former Petition to Your excellency, he is an industrious young Man and is Striveing to Make an honorable liveing & no doubt will unless there is too many obstacles thrown in his path of fortune to prevent the same. hoping that this will sufficie they humbly submit the same to your Excellency Your Respectfully

March 27th 1861
W E Hamilton
Issac Pelfrey
Thomas Jones
Jones

Wesley Hill Jr
Samuel B Goodsn
